result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela M Racanelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angela M Racanelli is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angela M Racanelli was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

02:03 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  ADA Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2 and the Use of Dangerous Weapon on Count 1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months 

CONDITIONS:
-No threats/acts of violence against: Tyrone S.
-No contact with Tyrone S.
-Not use/possess alcohol
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served: 15 days credit 
-Days credit if revoked: 15 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes emailed to DOC

03:15 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
